alert.note: Alert for Garvin; Murray; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 7:14AM CST until December 13 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, east central Oklahoma, southeast Oklahoma and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Cleveland, McClain and Pottawatomie. In east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc and Seminole. In southeast Oklahoma, Hughes. In southern Oklahoma, Garvin and Murray. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 711 AM CST, Minor flooding is ongoing or has just ended across the the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen which will lead to minor flooding of poorly drained and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shawnee, Ada, Seminole, Tecumseh, Pauls Valley, Holdenville, Davis, Wewoka, Wynnewood, Pink, Stratford, Konawa, Byng, Maud, Roff, Earlsboro, Paoli, Bowlegs, Asher and Tribbey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
